metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4235 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Due to unbounded alias chasing, a maliciously crafted YAML file can cause the system to consume significant system resources. If parsing user input, this may be used as a denial of service vector.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-gopkg-yaml.v3-dev - 2.2.3
No subscription required

golang-gopkg-yaml.v2-dev - 2.2.8-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> kubernates is in fact a kubernetes installer that calls snap, not the package it self.

criterions.comment: golang-github-coreos-discovery-etcd-io package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
golang-gopkg-yaml.v3 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.3').
golang-yaml.v2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.8-1').
kubernetes package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
webhook package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
